Reconstitution of a cell-free system and identification of the <extra_id_0> ubiquitin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - carrier protein , <extra_id_0> E2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and a novel <extra_id_0> ubiquitin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - protein ligase , <extra_id_0> E3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , involved in conjugation .

In most cases , the transcriptional factor NF-kappa B is a heterodimer consisting of two subunits , <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , which are encoded by two distinct genes of the Rel family .

text: <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is translated as a precursor of 105 kDa .
The C-terminal domain of the precursor is rapidly degraded , forming the mature <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> subunit consisted of the N-terminal region of the molecule .
The mechanism of generation of <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is not known .

It has been suggested that the <extra_id_0> ubiquitin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - proteasome system is involved in the process ; however , the specific enzymes involved and the mechanism of limited proteolysis , in which half of the molecule is spared , have been obscure .

Palombella and colleagues ( Palombella , V.J . , Rando , O.J . , Goldberg , A.L . , and Maniatis , T . ( 1994 ) Cell 78 , 773-785 ) have shown that <extra_id_0> ubiquitin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is required for the processing in a cell-free system of a truncated , artificially constructed , 60-kDa precursor .
They have also shown that proteasome inhibitors block the processing both in vitro and in vivo .

In this study , we demonstrate reconstitution of a cell-free processing system and demonstrate directly that : ( a ) the <extra_id_0> ubiquitin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - proteasome system is involved in processing of the intact <extra_id_0> p105 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> precursor , ( b ) conjugation of ubiquitin to the precursor is an essential intermediate step in the processing , ( c ) the recently discovered novel species of the <extra_id_0> ubiquitin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - carrier protein , <extra_id_0> E2-F1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , that is involved in the conjugation and degradation of <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , is also required for the limited processing of the <extra_id_0> p105 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> precursor , and ( d ) a novel , approximately 320-kDa species of <extra_id_0> ubiquitin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - protein ligase , is involved in the process .
